content: 10,000 more troops sought for Afghanistan Apr 1, 2009 The top U.S. general in Afghanistan wants an additional 10,000 troops in 2010 beyond the 21,000 approved for the current year, according to testimony today during a Senate Armed Services Committee hearing. If the request by Gen. David McKiernan is OK’d by President Barack Obama, it would bring the total U.S. force in Afghanistan to about 78,000 sometime in 2010. That would be an increase of 40,000 troops over the current total. Full report at > The Army Times >http://www.armytimes.com/news/2009/04/military_afghanistan_moretroops_040109w/

That would be an increase of 40,000 troops over the current total. Full report at > The Army Times >http://www.armytimes.com/news/2009/04/military_afghanistan_moretroops_040109w/
title: 10,000 more troops sought for Afghanistan

content: Army, for first time, sends unit from Iraq to Afghanistan Stars and Stripes Mideast edition, Wednesday, Aprli 2, 2009 An Army unit in Iraq has been shifted directly to Afghanistan, marking what defense officials said was the first time such a move has been made between the two war zones. The 100th Brigade Support Battalion had been serving in Iraq since December, but was “repositioned” to southern Afghanistan at the end of March, officials said. The shift comes amid a larger change in the focus of U.S. military efforts from Iraq to Afghanistan. Last week, President Barack Obama announced a revamped war strategy, part of which involves sending at least 4,000 additional military trainers to Afghanistan. Obama also had previously announced that 17,000 more U.S. troops would be added in Afghanistan this year. The new strategy also beefs up the number of civilian specialists in the country, along with putting increased emphasis on Pakistan and the tribal areas surrounding the border. Full article at > >http://www.stripes.com/article.asp?section=104&article=61751
